title: lp-do-ideas Dispatch Packet (dispatch.v1)
description: Dispatch packet emitted by the lp-do-ideas trial orchestrator for each processed standing-artifact delta. All fields labelled required must be present for schema validation to pass.

schema_version.description: Schema version identifier. Must be 'dispatch.v1' in this tranche.

dispatch_id.description: Unique dispatch identifier. Format: IDEA-DISPATCH-<YYYYMMDDHHmmss>-<seq4>. Example: IDEA-DISPATCH-20260224153000-0001.

mode.description: Operating mode. Only 'trial' is permitted in this tranche. 'live' is reserved for future go-live integration and must be rejected fail-closed.

trigger.description: Trigger type. 'artifact_delta' — a standing artifact was already updated; this dispatch processes the diff. 'operator_idea' — new information or signal provided directly by the operator, not yet reflected in any artifact; artifact updates are downstream outputs of the work this dispatch triggers.

artifact_id.description: Registered artifact key from the standing registry. Must match an entry in the standing registry.

before_sha.description: Git commit SHA or content hash of the artifact before the delta.

after_sha.description: Git commit SHA or content hash of the artifact after the delta.

area_anchor.description: Feature, component, or system area this dispatch addresses. Required for lp-do-fact-find intake routing.

location_anchors.description: One or more paths, routes, endpoints, or flows relevant to this dispatch. Must be non-empty. Required for lp-do-fact-find intake routing.

provisional_deliverable_family.description: Provisional deliverable family for routing and fact-find intake completeness check.

current_truth.description: Plain-language statement of what is now true after this delta.

next_scope_now.description: What should be investigated or acted on now in response to this delta.

adjacent_later.description: Optional future opportunities identified alongside this dispatch. May be empty.

recommended_route.description: Downstream routing recommendation. 'lp-do-fact-find' for planning work; 'lp-do-briefing' for understanding-only work. No other values are valid.

status.description: Dispatch lifecycle status. Transitions are monotonic: dispatches move forward only.

priority.description: Dispatch priority. P1 is highest. Used for escalation path to Option C autonomy mode.

confidence.description: Confidence score 0.0–1.0 for this dispatch being actionable.

evidence_refs.description: One or more artifact paths or anchors supporting this dispatch. Must be non-empty.

created_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when this dispatch was created.

queue_state.description: Current queue lifecycle state for this dispatch.

fact_find_slug.description: Feature slug of the fact-find that consumed this dispatch (e.g. 'hbag-pricing-uplift-2026-02').

fact_find_path.description: Canonical path to the fact-find.md that consumed this dispatch.

processed_at.description: ISO 8601 timestamp when the fact-find was opened against this dispatch.

route.description: How the fact-find was opened. 'dispatch-routed' = opened via queue confirmation with Dispatch-ID in frontmatter. 'direct-inject' = operator invoked directly; Trigger-Source cited instead.

processed_by.description: Populated when a fact-find or briefing has been opened against this dispatch. Presence sets queue_state to 'processed'. Absence means the dispatch is still pending.

triggered_by.description: Dispatch ID of the packet whose downstream build produced the artifact change that triggered this dispatch. Absent when triggered by direct operator action or an external signal. Presence indicates a cascade step — the operator should confirm this represents genuinely new work.

questions.description: Specific questions the operator must answer before this dispatch can be correctly scoped or invoked.

blocks_invocation.description: If true, all questions must be resolved before the downstream skill is invoked. If false, questions are advisory — invocation may proceed but scope may shift once resolved.

clarification_needed.description: Present when the dispatch cannot be fully routed or scoped without operator input. Absence means no clarification is needed.
